did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: George Alfred Townsend Letters, 1892 Oct 26, n.d.
did.abstract: The collection consists of two letters, 1982 Oct 26 and undated, from George Alfred Townsend to Joseph Stoddart and S.E. Moffett.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Alfred Townsend Letters, Accession #9577, Clifton Waller Barrett Library, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was put on deposit in the Library on 7 Jan 1971.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: George Alfred Townsend (1841-1913), was an American journalist and author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter, 1892 October 26, from George Alfred Townsend, "Gapland," Washington County, Maryland, to Joseph Marshall Stoddart, Townsend discusses revisions of a story to begin in the court of Queen Isabell, and comments on the Columbian Exhibition which he reported for the Chicago Tribune. In another, undated, letter to Samuel Erasmus Moffet, he finds members of the political parties unwilling to speak as freely after the demoralizing "Columbus Celebration" but expects to do better in Chicago.
